dialogues.text: What are you making:

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: What's a tree?

dialogues.speaker: ZALTAR
dialogues.text: It's something they have on Earth. You know, where your cousin went.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: Where is Earth?

dialogues.speaker: ZALTAR
dialogues.text: Didn't you study six-dimensional geometry in  school?

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: Yes, I know the equations---I just can't see it in  my head. Zaltar laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even I have trouble with that sometimes. Earth is in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: outer space. And we're in inner space.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: I don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: ZALTAR
dialogues.text: Wait till you're older. Here -- watch this.  Zaltar takes a small OMEGAHEDRON out of his pocket and ho

dialogues.text: This is one of the four Power Sources of the City.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I borrowed it from the Guardians. Look what I  can do with it.  Zaltar touches his MATTER.WAND to the OMEGAHEDRON and the sculpture comes alive with dancing lights and shadows. Ka at the spectacle. Zaltar steps back and admires his handi OMEGAHEDRON at his feet, takes a small flask from his bel ZALTAR You see, a tree is a living thing. KARA Can you create life?

dialogues.speaker: ZALTAR
dialogues.text: No, no, just the illusion of life. A kind of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: half-life, maybe. A pale shadow of the real  thing. But it is lovely, the way the light plays  over the surface. . .  A woman's voice can be heard calling in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Kara. Kara. Kara calls out in reply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here, mother. Kara's mother ALURA appears through the lacey architectur

dialogues.speaker: ALURA
dialogues.text: Kara, you shouldn't be so near the Edge

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: without a grown-up.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Mother.

dialogues.speaker: ZALTAR
dialogues.text: I was keeping an eye on her. Alura puts her arm around her daughter affectionately, sh

dialogues.speaker: ALURA
dialogues.text: Thank you, Zaltar, but she has to obey the rules.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zaltar takes another swig from his flask. and lowers his

dialogues.speaker: ZALTAR
dialogues.text: You and your husband have been kind to me,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alura. I have something to tell you: I'm going  away. Soon.

dialogues.speaker: ALURA
dialogues.text: But where? Zaltar bends down to Kara and hands her his matterwand.

dialogues.speaker: ZALTAR
dialogues.text: Put your fingers there, Kara. And press hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She does, and the wand makes a horrible squawk. Kara laug

dialogues.speaker: ZALTAR
dialogues.text: Good. Now, go make something pretty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kara scampers away, hardly able to believe her good fortu surprising sounds with the wand on the plaza nearby. Zalt

dialogues.text: I've discovered a new way into the Phantom  Zone.

dialogues.speaker: ALURA
dialogues.text: But the phantom Zone is for criminals.

dialogues.speaker: ZALTAR
dialogues.text: It's big. And empty. I'm tired of limiting myself  to  Argo City. I want to do something new. I'm  starting to repeat myself here with this airy,  glittery stuff.... Zaltar waves a hand deprecatingly at the city around him.

dialogues.speaker: ALURA
dialogues.text: But Zaltar---you founded the city! It's yours. We

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: were all just refugees from Krypton when you gathered  us together and brought us here, to the inner dimension.  You can't abandon us now. You have a responsibility to us In the background, Kara has been modeling a spiky insect-

dialogues.speaker: ZALTAR
dialogues.text: I'm an artist, Alura. My work comes first. Other  people come second.

dialogues.speaker: ALURA
dialogues.text: How can you create beauty...with a selfish heart? The spiky insect-creature flies closer and closer around The spiky creature flies into the membrane and tears a ra

dialogues.speaker: ZALTAR
dialogues.text: Kara---the Power Source! Kara reaches for it, but it is too far from her, and the The wind dies down and all is silent, except for the quie

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: I'm sorry... I didn't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was my fault. You aren't old enough to use

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the wand. I shouldn't have given it to you.

dialogues.speaker: ALURA
dialogues.text: But the Power Source, Zaltar.

dialogues.speaker: ZALTAR
dialogues.text: It couldn't be helped. The city will have to make do  with three.

dialogues.speaker: ALURA
dialogues.text: But what will happen?

dialogues.speaker: ZALTAR
dialogues.text: The Guardians will be angry. They may even  send me to the Phantom Zone. You see, I didn't  really have permission to borrow it. I must go  explain to them... Zaltar hurries off nervously. THE CAMERA HOLDS ON KARA'S

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling over her shoulder)

dialogues.speaker: KARA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earth. The journey is dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: It was my fault we lost the Power Source.

dialogues.speaker: ZOR-EL
dialogues.text: Years ago. And it was Zaltar who stole it.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: I allowed it to escape the City.

dialogues.speaker: ALURA
dialogues.text: Ever since we told you how your cousin Superman  was sent there as an infant, all you have wanted to do  was visit this place.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: Yes, I do want to go. But someone must go. Our  scanning shows the Power Source has finally  reached the Earth. It could destroy everything unless  someone brings it back.

dialogues.speaker: ZOR-EL
dialogues.text: Superman will return it.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: Why haven't you been able to contact him? He should  have returned from the neutron galaxy ages ago. He  may be dead.

dialogues.speaker: ZOR-EL
dialogues.text: But what can you, a mere girl-

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: I'll have super powers there. Like him. We can't wait.  Our lights are fading. Look around you. When I was a  child the City was bright and shining. Look at it now. Zor-El and Alura sigh. There is no denying that the brill

dialogues.text: What do your teachers think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zor-El looks around the circle. A beautiful woman speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would be sad to lose one of our finest young ones

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: to the dimension barrier-- but the City cannot last much  longer without the Power Source. It is her future she's  fighting for, Zor-El.

dialogues.speaker: ZOR-EL
dialogues.text: Very well, let it be done. Alura embraces Kara emotionally, fighting back the tears.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: Don't worry, Mother, I'll be all right. I've studied

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the transmissions from Earth. I know their customs. Kara walks out of the amphitheater with her parents.

dialogues.speaker: ALURA
dialogues.text: But they are such strange, unstable people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I will learn to act strange like them.

dialogues.text: Kara holds up a small handbag. Inside we glimpse red and

dialogues.text: will be fine. Her father puts his hand on her shoulder .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be brave, my .daughter. Be wise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As brave as my father. As wise.

dialogues.text: It may well be. I know how you won that election

dialogues.text: Nigel, get out of here. And don't come slithering

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

He falls silent, and tosses a few pebbles into the stream
